verses.text: A Song of Degrees. Unto thee who dwellest in heaven have I lifted up mine eyes.

Behold, as the eyes of servants \add are directed\add* to the hands of their masters, \add and\add* as the eyes of a maid-servant to the hands of her mistress; so our eyes \add are directed\add* to the Lord our God, until he have mercy upon us.
Have pity upon us, O Lord, have pity upon us: for we are exceedingly filled with contempt.

\add Yea\add*, our soul has been exceedingly filled \add with it\add*: \f + \fr 122:4 \fqa Or, \ft we are the reproach of them that are at ease.\f*\add let\add* the reproach \add be\add* to them that are at ease, and contempt to the proud.
